snippet: A Moscow court’s ruling this summer linked four defendants to one of the world’s most prolific illegal networks of virus-infected computers that send spam.
abstract: Moscow court’s ruling links four defendants to one of the world’s most prolific spambots, or illegal networks of virus-infected computers that send spam; infected computers, more often than not, are in India, Brazil and other developing countries where users cannot afford virus protection, but high-end programming of viruses often takes place in Russia.
lead_paragraph: A Moscow court’s ruling this summer linked four defendants to one of the world’s most prolific illegal networks of virus-infected computers that send spam.

headline.main: Online Attack Leads to Peek Into Spam Den
headline.print_headline:
After an Online Attack,
A Peek Into a Spam Den
